intro: Sisymbrium pauciflorum, commonly known as the lesser whitlow grass, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features slender stems covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium pauciflorum is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is adapted to temperate climates.
